channel.title: RuneSpan
channel.description: Has anyone tried it yet? I'm rather skeptical so I'd like feedback from people that have used it until the wiki catches up and I can look there :)

Living Rock Cavern

RuneScape Wiki

Living Rock Caverns

The Living Rock Caverns is a members-only area that was added on 17 September 2009. The area was designed for players with high levels in Fishing and Mining. There are no quest or skill requirements necessary to enter this area. However, it is a...

item.title: RuneSpan
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Basically you go around siphoning energy from creatures and nodes making runes. These runes are converted into points when you leave and you can get cool stuff.

Also, to anyone with 59 runecrafting, cosmic runes are the way to go right now. With 66 agility and having The Elder Kiln finished, each trip takes roughly 00:01:15, meaning between 44-48 trips and hour including slight mishaps. This equates to 1892 - 2064 essence crafted an hour with small, medium and large pouches, and making a minimum of 3784 - 4128 cosmic runes. This is 482,460 - 526,320 coins in PURE PROFIT an hour. Yes, thats with the cost of pure essence (85 each when I bought it) subtracted already, making these better than nature runes right now.

Its also about 880-960 agility xp per hour, so you get that as an added bonus.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneSpan
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

For some reason I actually find this very fun, must be because of the fast exp. It’s about time they done something about such skills. I completely gave up on runecrafting at level 56, 30k exp for a day was very bad.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneSpan
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Idk since I don’t play anymore, but with the high rc levels and multipliers runes should change in price that much. Unless influenced by something that requires magic, like a new boss. Which gives me the thought they should have a boss that requires different spell types (fire, earth, water, wind) if they don’t already have one.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneSpan
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Rodger: Correct me if I’m wrong, but couldn’t this make RCing more profitable?
The prise on Pure ess would decrease because of lower demand, and the price of rune would increase because of lower supply?

The only thing I see that work against this, is the increasing amount of people who will get a higher RC level.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneSpan
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:23, topic:441039”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=543717.msg3986481#msg3986481 date=1335937994]
I particularily liked the bugs yesterday, giving me like 110k exp an hour (node spawning everywhere constantly).

I have gotten almost 700k exp since the release of this, and i plan to go on for 99.

Runecrafting is the new Woodcutting, true story.
[/quote]

And it’s about time! Runecrafting was the last boring skill to train. I’m glad they finally added a fun and fast way to do it. Now it just needs to become useful…[/quote]

I enjoyed the original rcing tbh. Where people actually “ran” runes and people would trade essence + runes for the exp. There there was the assist system when it came out.

The only thing I disliked about it is the pouches, it should of been a one click fill feature from the bank and another 1 click to empty them all.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneSpan
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:25, topic:441039”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=543717.msg3986645#msg3986645 date=1335976802]

I particularily liked the bugs yesterday, giving me like 110k exp an hour (node spawning everywhere constantly).

I have gotten almost 700k exp since the release of this, and i plan to go on for 99.

Runecrafting is the new Woodcutting, true story.

And it’s about time! Runecrafting was the last boring skill to train. I’m glad they finally added a fun and fast way to do it. Now it just needs to become useful…
[/quote]It isn’t here to replace the old way though, it is just a substitute for those of us who do not give a fuck about profit.

Either way, whatever use runecrafting has only exists at higher levels. I can’t really anyone training RC using the conventional methods hereafter, unless they are just ignorant (or want the profits from training with nats, but the time-versus-profit ratio is ridiculous until doubles anyway).[/quote]Double astrals are still decent profit too, but of course there are far faster ways. Some people prefer to kill two birds with one stone though.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneSpan
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:24, topic:441039”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=543717.msg3986638#msg3986638 date=1335976144]

I particularily liked the bugs yesterday, giving me like 110k exp an hour (node spawning everywhere constantly).

I have gotten almost 700k exp since the release of this, and i plan to go on for 99.

Runecrafting is the new Woodcutting, true story.

And it’s about time! Runecrafting was the last boring skill to train. I’m glad they finally added a fun and fast way to do it. Now it just needs to become useful…
[/quote]It isn’t here to replace the old way though, it is just a substitute for those of us who do not give a fuck about profit.[/quote]

Either way, whatever use runecrafting has only exists at higher levels. I can’t really anyone training RC using the conventional methods hereafter, unless they are just ignorant (or want the profits from training with nats, but the time-versus-profit ratio is ridiculous until doubles anyway).

Read full topic
